OCMPU.description: OCMEM Memory Protection Unit. This read-only field identifies a memory protected by an XRDC module.

OCMT.description: OCMEM Type. This field defines the type of the on-chip memory:

OCMW.description: OCMEM datapath Width. This read-only field defines the width of the on-chip memory:

V.description: OCMEM Valid bit. This read-only field defines the validity (presence) of the on-chip memory

EARS.description: Enable Asynchronous Request in Stop Register

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

TCD%s_DLASTSGA.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

ERRCHN.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

VLD.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

SAST.description: Set All START Bits (activates all channels)

EDREQ_0.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 0.

EDREQ_1.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 1.

EDREQ_2.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 2.

EDREQ_3.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 3.

EDREQ_4.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 4

EDREQ_5.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 5

EDREQ_6.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 6

EDREQ_7.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 7

MLOFF.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

ELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete
Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

DLASTSGA.description: Destination last address adjustment or the memory address for the next transfer control descriptor to be loaded into this channel (scatter/gather)

INTMAJOR.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

INTHALF.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

MAJORELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

ELINK.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete
Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

NMDAR.description: Number of master domain assignment registers for bus master n

NMGD.description: Number of memory region descriptors for MRC i

EADDR.description: Error address. This is the access address that generated an access violation.

EDID.description: Error domain identifier. This field captures the domain identifier of the access violation.

EATR.description: Error attributes. This field captures certain attributes of the access violation.

D1ACP.description: Domain 1 access control policy. See description for D7ACP .

D4ACP.description: Domain 4 access control policy. See description for D7ACP .

D5ACP.description: Domain 5 access control policy. See description for D7ACP .

D6ACP.description: Domain 6 access control policy. See description for D7ACP .

SNUM.description: Semaphore number. Include this hardware semaphore in the DxACP access evaluation.

ROZ.description: This field always returns the value 0 when read.
This field always returns the value 0 when read.

Fn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2} Processor A/B Side Flag n

TEn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B Transmit Register n Empty

RFn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B Receive Register n Full

GIPn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B General Interrupt Request n Pending

Fn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2} Processor A/B to Processor B/A Flag n

GIRn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B General Purpose Interrupt Request n

TIEn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B Transmit Interrupt Enable n

RIEn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B Receive Interrupt Enable n

GIEn.description: For n = {0, 1, 2, 3} Processor A/B General Purpose Interrupt Enable n

TOFDIR.description: Indicates if the TOF bit was set on the top or the bottom of counting.

QUADIR.description: Counter Direction in Quadrature Decode Mode

IGNACK.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

RXEDGIE.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

RXEDGIF.description: LPUART_RX Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: LPUART_TX Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

R0T0.description: Read receive data buffer 0 or write transmit data buffer 0.

R1T1.description: Read receive data buffer 1 or write transmit data buffer 1.

R2T2.description: Read receive data buffer 2 or write transmit data buffer 2.

R3T3.description: Read receive data buffer 3 or write transmit data buffer 3.

R4T4.description: Read receive data buffer 4 or write transmit data buffer 4.

R5T5.description: Read receive data buffer 5 or write transmit data buffer 5.

R6T6.description: Read receive data buffer 6 or write transmit data buffer 6.

R7T7.description: Read receive data buffer 7 or write transmit data buffer 7.

R8T8.description: Read receive data buffer 8 or write transmit data buffer 8.

R9T9.description: Read receive data buffer 9 or write transmit data buffer 9.

PARITYE.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a parity error.

NOISY.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with noise.

GPCNT0_VAL.description: General Purpose Counter 0 Timeout Value Register

INV_CRC_VAL.description: Invert bits in the CRC Output Value

CRC_OUT_FLIP.description: CRC Output Value Bit Reversal or Flip

CRC_IN_FLIP.description: CRC Input Byte's Bit Reversal or Flip Control

GPCNT0_IM.description: General Purpose Timer 0 Timeout Interrupt Mask

CWT_ERR_IM.description: Character Wait Time Error Interrupt Mask

BWT_ERR_IM.description: Block Wait Time Error Interrupt Mask

GPCNT1_IM.description: General Purpose Counter 1 Timeout Interrupt Mask

SPDIM.description: Smart Card Presence Detect Interrupt Mask

SPDIF.description: Smart Card Presence Detect Interrupt Flag

SPDP.description: Smart Card Presence Detect Pin Status

GETU.description: Transmitter Guard Time Value in ETU

IEHOST.description: This bit is set if host mode is enabled.

LINE_STATE_CHG.description: This interrupt is set when the USB line state (CTL[SE0] and CTL[JSTATE] bits) are stable without change for 1 millisecond, and the value of the line state is different from the last time when the line state was stable

ONEMSEC.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires

LINESTATESTABLE.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 ms

ONEMSECEN.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.

DMLOW.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

DPLOW.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

DPHIGH.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

USBRST.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

ERROR.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

SOFTOK.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token

TOKDNE.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

SLEEP.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

RESUME.description: This bit is set when a K-state is observed on the DP/DM signals for 2

PIDERR.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

CRC5EOF.description: This error interrupt has two functions

CRC16.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

DFN8.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

BTOERR.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

DMAERR.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

OWNERR.description: This field is valid when the USB Module is operating in peripheral mode (CTL[HOSTMODEEN]=0)

BTSERR.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

ODD.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

ENDP.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

ODDRST.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

RESUME.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling

HOSTMODEEN.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

RESET.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling

TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

SE0.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

JSTATE.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

FRM.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

TOKENENDPT.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command

TOKENPID.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

CNT.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=0 or 8 byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=1

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

EPHSHK.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

EPSTALL.description: When set, this bit indicates that the endpoint is stalled

EPTXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers. See

EPRXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers. See

EPCTLDIS.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

RETRYDIS.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

HOSTWOHUB.description: Host without a hub This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

UARTSEL.description: Selects USB signals to be used as UART signals.

PDE.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

SUSP.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

DMPD.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

DPPD.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

DPPU.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup enable at the USB transceiver.

DPPULLUPNONOTG.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in USBOTG, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode.

USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.description: Combined USB Clock Recovery interrupt status

OWN_OVERRD_EN.description: When set to 1, during KEEP_ALIVE mode, if received token is not SETUP, the OWN bit of current BD will be forced to 0, so usb core will respond with NAK

WAKE_REQ_EN.description: During KEEP_ALIVE mode, a bus access by the USB controller to a memory location outside the USB SRAM will cause the bus access to stall until KEEP_ALIVE mode is exited

WAKE_ON_THIS.description: Software configure it to which token can wakeup usb during KEEP_ALIVE mode

WAKE_ENDPT.description: Indicates which endpoint causes the wakeup interrupt. Reset to 0, software read only.

OWNERRISODIS.description: OWN Error Detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT Disable

OVF_ERROR_EN.description: Determines whether OVF_ERROR condition signal is used in generation of USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.

OVF_ERROR.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the FIRC output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the FIRC module

GENCS.description: TSI General Control and Status Register

EOSDMEO.description: End-of-Scan DMA Transfer Request Enable Only

MODE.description: TSI analog modes setup and status bits.

CLPD.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLPS.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP4.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP3.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP2.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP1.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP0.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLMD.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLMS.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM4.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM3.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM2.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM1.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM0.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

DACBFRPBF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

DACBFRPTF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

DACBBIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

DACBTIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

CHOPEN.description: Chop oscillator enable. When set, the internal chopping operation is enabled and the internal analog offset will be minimized.

TRESEN.description: Test second order curvature compensation enable

USBVSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during VLPR and VLPW modes

USBSSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during Stop, VLPS, LLS and VLLS modes.

URWE.description: USB voltage regulator enable write enable

UVSWE.description: USB voltage regulator VLP standby write enable

USSWE.description: USB voltage regulator stop standby write enable

CMD32EN.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (or 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

CNTLOW.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

CNTHIGH.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

TOVALLOW.description: Low byte of the timeout value

TOVALHIGH.description: High byte of the timeout value;

CMD32EN.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (or 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

CNTLOW.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

CNTHIGH.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

TOVALLOW.description: Low byte of the timeout value

TOVALHIGH.description: High byte of the timeout value;

DATAL.description: DATAL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATALL.description: CRCLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit DATA

DATALU.description: DATALL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAH.description: DATAH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATAHL.description: DATAHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAHU.description: DATAHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYL.description: POLYL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYLL.description: POLYLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYLU.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYH.description: POLYH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYHL.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYHU.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

WAS.description: Write CRC Data Register As Seed

FXOR.description: Complement Read Of CRC Data Register

SOSCCMRE.description: System OSC Clock Monitor Reset Enable

SPLLCMRE.description: System PLL Clock Monitor Reset Enable

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register

HVDSC1.description: High Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

ELLS.description: Enable LLS (if this mode exists on the SOC)

ELLS2.description: Enable LLS2 (if this mode exists on the SOC)

EVLLS0.description: Enable VLLS0 (if this mode exists on the SOC)

LVD.description: Low-Voltage Detect Reset or High-Voltage Detect Reset

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

PKRSQ.description: TRNG Poker Square Calculation Result Register

FRQMIN.description: TRNG Frequency Count Minimum Limit Register

FRQMAX.description: TRNG Frequency Count Maximum Limit Register

SCMC.description: TRNG Statistical Check Monobit Count Register

SCML.description: TRNG Statistical Check Monobit Limit Register

SCR1C.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 1 Count Register

SCR1L.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 1 Limit Register

SCR2C.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 2 Count Register

SCR2L.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 2 Limit Register

SCR3C.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 3 Count Register

SCR3L.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 3 Limit Register

SCR4C.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 4 Count Register

SCR4L.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 4 Limit Register

SCR5C.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 5 Count Register

SCR5L.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 5 Limit Register

SCR6PC.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 6+ Count Register

SCR6PL.description: TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 6+ Limit Register

PKRCNT10.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count 1 and 0 Register

PKRCNT32.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count 3 and 2 Register

PKRCNT54.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count 5 and 4 Register

PKRCNT76.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count 7 and 6 Register

PKRCNT98.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count 9 and 8 Register

PKRCNTBA.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count B and A Register

PKRCNTDC.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count D and C Register

PKRCNTFE.description: TRNG Statistical Check Poker Count F and E Register

UNUSED.description: This bit is unused but write-able. Must be left as zero.

FCT_VAL.description: Read only: Frequency Count Valid. Indicates that a valid frequency count may be read from FRQCNT.

TST_OUT.description: Read only: Test point inside ring oscillator.

TF1BR0.description: Test Fail, 1-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF1BR0=1, the 1-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF1BR1.description: Test Fail, 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF1BR1=1, the 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF2BR0.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF2BR0=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF2BR1.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF2BR1=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF3BR0.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF3BR0=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF3BR1.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF3BR1=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF4BR0.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF4BR0=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF4BR1.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF4BR1=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF5BR0.description: Test Fail, 5-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF5BR0=1, the 5-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF5BR1.description: Test Fail, 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF5BR1=1, the 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF6PBR0.description: Test Fail, 6 Plus Bit Run, Sampling 0s

TF6PBR1.description: Test Fail, 6 Plus Bit Run, Sampling 1s

TFSB.description: Test Fail, Sparse Bit. If TFSB=1, the Sparse Bit Test has failed.

TFLR.description: Test Fail, Long Run. If TFLR=1, the Long Run Test has failed.

TFP.description: Test Fail, Poker. If TFP=1, the Poker Test has failed.

TFMB.description: Test Fail, Mono Bit. If TFMB=1, the Mono Bit Test has failed.

SH0.description: Reserved. DRNG specific, not applicable to this version.

NO_PRGM.description: If set, the TRNG registers cannot be programmed

SK_VAL.description: Reserved. DRNG-specific, not applicable to this version.

HW_ERR.description: Bit position that can be cleared if corresponding bit of INT_STATUS has been asserted.
Bit position that can be cleared if corresponding bit of INT_STATUS has been asserted.

MIN_REV.description: Shows the Freescale IP's Minor revision of the TRNG.

MAJ_REV.description: Shows the Freescale IP's Major revision of the TRNG.

CONFIG_OPT.description: Shows the Freescale IP's Configuaration options for the TRNG.

ECO_REV.description: Shows the Freescale IP's ECO revision of the TRNG.

INTG_OPT.description: Shows the Freescale integration options for the TRNG.

ERA.description: Shows the Freescale compile options for the TRNG.

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
